Please write a Python code that generates a humorous sentence by randomly selecting two elements from the following lists and combining them with "He was about to give a speech".
List 1: ["wearing a clown nose", "wearing a tutu", "covered in glitter", "holding a rubber chicken"]
List 2: ["when he realized he was wearing his pants backwards", "when he saw the crowd was actually a group of cats", "when his phone started playing the wrong song", "when a bird flew into the room and perched on his head"]
The output should be a string that combines the randomly selected elements with "He was about to give a speech".

Certainly! Below is a Python code that generates a humorous sentence by randomly selecting one element from each of the provided lists and combining them with the phrase "He was about to give a speech."

```python
import random

list1 = ["wearing a clown nose", "wearing a tutu", "covered in glitter", "holding a rubber chicken"]
list2 = ["when he realized he was wearing his pants backwards", 
         "when he saw the crowd was actually a group of cats", 
         "when his phone started playing the wrong song", 
         "when a bird flew into the room and perched on his head"]

def generate_humorous_sentence():
    part1 = random.choice(list1)
    part2 = random.choice(list2)
    sentence = f"He was about to give a speech {part1} {part2}."
    return sentence

# Generate and print a humorous sentence
print(generate_humorous_sentence())
```

This code uses the `random.choice()` function to randomly select one element from each list and then constructs a sentence using string formatting. Each time you run the code, it will produce a different humorous sentence.
